greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = digit reversal of 3*n divided by 3.
comment: If n is a multiple of 10, then a(n) = a(n/10); if n is not a multiple of 10, then a(a(n)) = n.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_ and Meenakshi Srikanth (menakan_s(AT)yahoo.com), May 08 2003
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 11 2003
